page.title: 20Roads,Greenlanes & Services
page.content: The Garton block contains many paths, lanes and roads.Some of these are pre- historic trackways as well as a Roman road.There are also a number of pleasant greenlanes now only used by farmers and walkers.They are 9 to 14 metres wide and may be ancient track- ways,early estate boundaries or even old drove roads. The Driffield to Malton railway line opened in 1853 and a station was opened near the village.The line was closed for passengers in 1950 and for goods in l958. During the inclosures of 1771 two new roads were created.One of these became the A166 Driffield to York road passing through the village.There are two bus services-Driffield to Malton and vice versa.There are 3,4 & 5 buses a day except Monday and Thursday when there is only one.
